title: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67
medium: Transparent watercolor and white gouache, graphite indicating fan shape on white wove paper
inscribed:
Upper left, pen and black ink: Eous 1866; in graphite: No 1 
Lower left, in graphite: No 28
Upper right, in graphite: 534
description:
Fan design consisting of 3 images:
At left: Classical bust, right profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape
Center: Dancing young Bacchus holding a tambourine in left hand and a spear in right hand on green ground, twig and leaf border encircled by blue ribbon, bows at either side, circular shape. Inscribed on ribbon, bottom center, pen and black ink, À Paris Exposition Universel de 1867
At right: classical bust, left profile of a woman, terracotta ground, octagonal shape

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67.Transparent watercolor and white gouache, graphite indicating fan shape on white wove paper. Gift of M. Roy Fisher. 1976-105-1.
